public class Assert {
  public static void assertEquals(Integer expectedValue, Integer actualValue) {
    if (actualValue != expectedValue) {
      String message = String.format(
              "Test failed, expected: %d, actual: %d.", expectedValue, actualValue);
      System.out.println(message);
    } else {
      System.out.println("Test succeeded.");
    }
  }

  public static boolean assertNull(Integer actualValue) {
    boolean isNull = actualValue == null;
    if (isNull) {
      System.out.println("Test succeeded.");
    } else {
      System.out.println("Test failed, the value is not null:" + actualValue);
    }
    return isNull;
  }
}

public class TestCaseRunner {
  public static void main(String[] args) {
    System.out.println("Run testToNumber()");
    new TextTest().testToNumber();

    System.out.println("Run testToNumber_nullorEmpty()");
    new TextTest().testToNumber_nullorEmpty();

    System.out.println("Run testToNumber_containsLeadingAndTrailingSpaces()");
    new TextTest().testToNumber_containsLeadingAndTrailingSpaces();

    System.out.println("Run testToNumber_containsMultiLeadingAndTrailingSpaces()");
    new TextTest().testToNumber_containsMultiLeadingAndTrailingSpaces();

    System.out.println("Run testToNumber_containsInvalidCharaters()");
    new TextTest().testToNumber_containsInvalidCharaters();
  }
}

public class TextTest {
  public void testToNumber() {
    Text text = new Text("123");
    Assert.assertEquals(123, text.toNumber());
  }

  public void testToNumber_nullorEmpty() {
    Text text1 = new Text(null);
    Assert.assertNull(text1.toNumber());

    Text text2 = new Text("");
    Assert.assertNull(text2.toNumber());
  }

  public void testToNumber_containsLeadingAndTrailingSpaces() {
    Text text1 = new Text(" 123");
    Assert.assertEquals(123, text1.toNumber());

    Text text2 = new Text("123 ");
    Assert.assertEquals(123, text2.toNumber());

    Text text3 = new Text(" 123 ");
    Assert.assertEquals(123, text3.toNumber());
  }

  public void testToNumber_containsMultiLeadingAndTrailingSpaces() {
    Text text1 = new Text("  123");
    Assert.assertEquals(123, text1.toNumber());

    Text text2 = new Text("123  ");
    Assert.assertEquals(123, text2.toNumber());

    Text text3 = new Text("  123  ");
    Assert.assertEquals(123, text3.toNumber());
  }

  public void testToNumber_containsInvalidCharaters() {
    Text text1 = new Text("123a4");
    Assert.assertNull(text1.toNumber());

    Text text2 = new Text("123 4");
    Assert.assertNull(text2.toNumber());
  }
}

import org.junit.Assert;
import org.junit.Test;

public class TextTest {
  @Test
  public void testToNumber() {
    Text text = new Text("123");
    Assert.assertEquals(new Integer(123), text.toNumber());
  }

  @Test
  public void testToNumber_nullorEmpty() {
    Text text1 = new Text(null);
    Assert.assertNull(text1.toNumber());

    Text text2 = new Text("");
    Assert.assertNull(text2.toNumber());
  }

  @Test
  public void testToNumber_containsLeadingAndTrailingSpaces() {
    Text text1 = new Text(" 123");
    Assert.assertEquals(new Integer(123), text1.toNumber());

    Text text2 = new Text("123 ");
    Assert.assertEquals(new Integer(123), text2.toNumber());

    Text text3 = new Text(" 123 ");
    Assert.assertEquals(new Integer(123), text3.toNumber());
  }

  @Test
  public void testToNumber_containsMultiLeadingAndTrailingSpaces() {
    Text text1 = new Text("  123");
    Assert.assertEquals(new Integer(123), text1.toNumber());

    Text text2 = new Text("123  ");
    Assert.assertEquals(new Integer(123), text2.toNumber());

    Text text3 = new Text("  123  ");
    Assert.assertEquals(new Integer(123), text3.toNumber());
  }

  @Test
  public void testToNumber_containsInvalidCharaters() {
    Text text1 = new Text("123a4");
    Assert.assertNull(text1.toNumber());

    Text text2 = new Text("123 4");
    Assert.assertNull(text2.toNumber());
  }
}

/**
* æŸ¥æ‰¾é€’å¢æ•°ç»„ä¸­ç¬¬ä¸€ä¸ªå¤§äºç­‰äºæŸä¸ªç»™å®šå€¼çš„å…ƒç´ 
* @return -1: æœªæ‰¾åˆ°
*/
public int findFirstEqualOrLargerIndex(int[] array, int num) {
if (array == null || array.length == 0) return -1;

int start = 0;
int end = array.length - 1;

while (start != end) {
int middle = start + (end - start) / 2;

if (array[middle] >= num) {
if (start == middle) return middle;
else
if (array[middle - 1] < num) return middle;
else end = middle -1;

} else {
start = middle + 1;
}
}
//start == end
if (array[start] >= num) {
return start;
} else {
return -1;
}
}

func binarySearch(arr []int, target int) int {
left, right := 0, len(arr)
ret := -1
for left < right {
mid := (left + right) >> 1
if arr[mid] == target {
ret = mid
break
} else if arr[mid] < target {
left = mid + 1
} else if arr[mid] > target {
right = mid
}
}

if ret == -1 {
if left < len(arr) && arr[left] == target {
ret = left
} else {
return -1
}
}

//åˆ¤æ–­å½“å‰å…ƒç´ æ˜¯å¦æ˜¯æœ€åä¸€ä¸ªä½ç½®
if ret == len(arr)-1 {
return -1
}

//æŸ¥æ‰¾æ˜¯å¦æœ‰é‡å¤å…ƒç´ 
for i := ret; i < len(arr); i++ {
if arr[i] != arr[ret] {
ret = i
break
}
}

if arr[ret] == target {
return -1
}

return arr[ret]

}

public static int findFirstEqualBiggerIdxOfSortedArray(int[] array, int num) {
if (array == null || array.length == 0) return -1;
int left = 0, right = array.length - 1, mid;
if (num > array[right]) return -1;
if (num <= array[left]) return left;
while (right - left - 1 > 0) {
mid = (left + right) / 2;
if (num <= array[mid]) {
right = mid;
} else {
left = mid;
}
if (num <= array[left]) {
return left;
}
}
return right;
}

//binary_search
package binary_search

import "errors"

var ArrayCanNotBeEmptyError = errors.New("array can not be empty")
var TargetIsNotFoundError = errors.New("can not find required target")

func binarySearch(array []int ,target int)(index int,err error){

if len(array)==0{
err = ArrayCanNotBeEmptyError
return
}
start:=0
end := len(array)-1
for true{
if end<start{
err = TargetIsNotFoundError
return
}
mid := (start +end) /2
if array[mid] > target{
end = mid-1
}else if array[mid]<target{
start = mid+1
}else{
index = mid
return
}
}
return
}

func Test_binarySearch(t *testing.T) {
type args struct {
array []int
target int
}
tests := []struct {

err error
}{

args{[]int{},1},
0,

},

args{[]int{2},1},
0,

},
{
"len(array) == 1 && target is found",
args{[]int{1},1},
0,
nil,
},
{
"len(array) is odd && target not found ",
args{[]int{2,3,4},1},
0,
TargetIsNotFoundError,
},
{
"len(array) is odd && target found ",
args{[]int{1,3,4},1},
0,
nil,
},
{
"len(array) is even && target not found ",
args{[]int{2,3,4,5},1},
0,
TargetIsNotFoundError,
},
{
"len(array) is even && target found ",
args{[]int{2,1,4,5},1},
1,
nil,
},
}
for _, tt := range tests {
t.Run(tt.name, func(t *testing.T) {
gotIndex, err := binarySearch(tt.args.array, tt.args.target)
if err != tt.err {
t.Errorf("binarySearch() error = %v, wantErr %v", err, tt.err)
return
}
if gotIndex != tt.wantIndex {
t.Errorf("binarySearch() gotIndex = %v, want %v", gotIndex, tt.wantIndex)
}
})
}
}

/**

* @return -1: æœªæ‰¾åˆ°

public int findFirstEqualOrLargerIndex(int[] array, int num) {
if (array == null || array.length == 0) return -1;

int start = 0;
int end = array.length - 1;

while (start != end) {
int middle = start + (end - start) / 2;

if (array[middle] >= num) {
if (start == middle) return middle;
else
if (array[middle - 1] < num) return middle;
else end = middle -1;

} else {
start = middle + 1;
}
}
//start == end
if (array[start] >= num) {
return start;
} else {
return -1;
}
}

func binarySearch(arr []int, target int) int {
left, right := 0, len(arr)
ret := -1
for left < right {
mid := (left + right) >> 1
if arr[mid] == target {
ret = mid
break
} else if arr[mid] < target {
left = mid + 1
} else if arr[mid] > target {
right = mid
}
}

if ret == -1 {
if left < len(arr) && arr[left] == target {
ret = left
} else {
return -1
}
}

//åˆ¤æ–­å½“å‰å…ƒç´ æ˜¯å¦æ˜¯æœ€åä¸€ä¸ªä½ç½®
if ret == len(arr)-1 {
return -1
}

//æŸ¥æ‰¾æ˜¯å¦æœ‰é‡å¤å…ƒç´ 
for i := ret; i < len(arr); i++ {
if arr[i] != arr[ret] {
ret = i
break
}
}

if arr[ret] == target {
return -1
}

return arr[ret]

}

public static int findFirstEqualBiggerIdxOfSortedArray(int[] array, int num) {
if (array == null || array.length == 0) return -1;
int left = 0, right = array.length - 1, mid;
if (num > array[right]) return -1;
if (num <= array[left]) return left;
while (right - left - 1 > 0) {
mid = (left + right) / 2;
if (num <= array[mid]) {
right = mid;
} else {
left = mid;
}
if (num <= array[left]) {
return left;
}
}
return right;
}

//binary_search
package binary_search

import "errors"

var ArrayCanNotBeEmptyError = errors.New("array can not be empty")
var TargetIsNotFoundError = errors.New("can not find required target")

func binarySearch(array []int ,target int)(index int,err error){

if len(array)==0{
err = ArrayCanNotBeEmptyError
return
}
start:=0
end := len(array)-1
for true{
if end<start{
err = TargetIsNotFoundError
return
}
mid := (start +end) /2
if array[mid] > target{
end = mid-1
}else if array[mid]<target{
start = mid+1
}else{
index = mid
return
}
}
return
}

package binary_search

import "testing"


func Test_binarySearch(t *testing.T) {
type args struct {
array []int
target int
}
tests := []struct {
name string
args args
wantIndex int
err error
}{
// TODO: Add test cases.
{
"len(array) == 0",
args{[]int{},1},
0,
ArrayCanNotBeEmptyError,
},
{
"len(array) == 1 && target not found",
args{[]int{2},1},
0,
TargetIsNotFoundError,
},
{
"len(array) == 1 && target is found",
args{[]int{1},1},
0,
nil,
},
{
"len(array) is odd && target not found ",
args{[]int{2,3,4},1},
0,
TargetIsNotFoundError,
},
{
"len(array) is odd && target found ",
args{[]int{1,3,4},1},
0,
nil,
},
{
"len(array) is even && target not found ",
args{[]int{2,3,4,5},1},
0,
TargetIsNotFoundError,
},
{
"len(array) is even && target found ",
args{[]int{2,1,4,5},1},
1,
nil,
},
}
for _, tt := range tests {
t.Run(tt.name, func(t *testing.T) {
gotIndex, err := binarySearch(tt.args.array, tt.args.target)
if err != tt.err {
t.Errorf("binarySearch() error = %v, wantErr %v", err, tt.err)
return
}
if gotIndex != tt.wantIndex {
t.Errorf("binarySearch() gotIndex = %v, want %v", gotIndex, tt.wantIndex)
}
})
}
}
